intro: Hermannia althaeifolia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive tubular corolla. Hermannia althaeifolia is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in indoor conditions.
